concept.title: HTTP Session Management and GemFire Purchase Options

conbody.p: The way you plan to use GemFire's HTTP Session Management Module will determine the particular GemFire offerings that are right for you. The table below should provide some guidance.

strow.stentry: If you plan to set up a peer-to-peer configuration, you will need to purchase an Application Cache Node for each peer. Additionally, unless you purchase the Unlimited Client Upgrade (specified below), you will need to purchase an Application Cache Node for each client in a client/server configuration.

If you plan to set up a client/server configuration, a Data Management Node is required for each server. Unless you purchase an Unlimited Client Upgrade, you will need to purchase an Application Cache Node for each client in a client/server configuration.
This upgrade is needed to connect Data Management Nodes together when you have multiple geographical regions. A Global WAN Upgrade must be applied to all Data Management Nodes in a data grid.
This upgrade allows unlimited client connectivity to a Data Management Node. It is a cost effective way to meet the needs of high-client topologies.

conbody.p: To better understand which node types are necessary for which configurations, refer to these illustrations.
